content.description: Source: Graph Supplied by BBC Studios
content.question: Which of the following is an implication of the data in the map?

choices.label: Scotland will likely see a big boom in tourism after the United Kingdom leaves the European Union, because European tourists will travel to Scotland rather than England.
Scotland has already formed several bilateral trade agreements with most European countries that are separate from the United Kingdom in an effort to promote independent trade.
Most Scottish people prefer to remain in the European Union, and the government will most likely work to maintain the free movement of goods and services to Europe.
Scotland will become completely sovereign when the United Kingdom leaves the European Union and must develop several new institutions.

content.answer: Most Scottish people prefer to remain in the European Union, and the government will most likely work to maintain the free movement of goods and services to Europe.

topic.text: 3.5: Nature and Role of Political Participation

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
